connector.description: Perform operations against Apache Lucene Solr.

camel.sink.path.url.name: camel.sink.path.url
camel.sink.path.url.description: Hostname and port for the Solr server(s). Multiple hosts can be specified, separated with a comma. See the solrClient parameter for more information on the SolrClient used to connect to Solr.

camel.sink.endpoint.autoCommit.name: camel.sink.endpoint.autoCommit
camel.sink.endpoint.autoCommit.description: If true, each producer operation will be automatically followed by a commit

camel.sink.endpoint.connectionTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.connectionTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.connectionTimeout.description: Sets the connection timeout on the SolrClient

camel.sink.endpoint.httpClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpClient
camel.sink.endpoint.httpClient.description: Sets the http client to be used by the solrClient. This is only applicable when solrClient is not set.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.maxRetries.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxRetries
camel.sink.endpoint.maxRetries.description: Maximum number of retries to attempt in the event of transient errors

camel.sink.endpoint.requestHandler.name: camel.sink.endpoint.requestHandler
camel.sink.endpoint.requestHandler.description: Set the request handler to be used

camel.sink.endpoint.solrClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.solrClient
camel.sink.endpoint.solrClient.description: Uses the provided solr client to connect to solr. When this parameter is not specified, camel applies the following rules to determine the SolrClient: 1) when zkHost or zkChroot (=zookeeper root) parameter is set, then the CloudSolrClient is used. 2) when multiple hosts are specified in the uri (separated with a comma), then the CloudSolrClient (uri scheme is 'solrCloud') or the LBHttpSolrClient (uri scheme is not 'solrCloud') is used. 3) when the solr operation is INSERT_STREAMING, then the ConcurrentUpdateSolrClient is used. 4) otherwise, the HttpSolrClient is used. Note: A CloudSolrClient should point to zookeeper endpoint(s); other clients point to Solr endpoint(s). The SolrClient can also be set via the exchange header 'CamelSolrClient'.

camel.sink.endpoint.soTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.soTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.soTimeout.description: Sets the socket timeout on the SolrClient

camel.sink.endpoint.streamingQueueSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.streamingQueueSize
camel.sink.endpoint.streamingQueueSize.description: Sets the queue size for the ConcurrentUpdateSolrClient

camel.sink.endpoint.streamingThreadCount.name: camel.sink.endpoint.streamingThreadCount
camel.sink.endpoint.streamingThreadCount.description: Sets the number of threads for the ConcurrentUpdateSolrClient

camel.sink.endpoint.collection.name: camel.sink.endpoint.collection
camel.sink.endpoint.collection.description: Set the default collection for SolrCloud

camel.sink.endpoint.zkChroot.name: camel.sink.endpoint.zkChroot
camel.sink.endpoint.zkChroot.description: Set the chroot of the zookeeper connection (include the leading slash; e.g. '/mychroot')

camel.sink.endpoint.zkHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.zkHost
camel.sink.endpoint.zkHost.description: Set the ZooKeeper host(s) urls which the CloudSolrClient uses, e.g. zkHost=localhost:2181,localhost:2182. Optionally add the chroot, e.g. zkHost=localhost:2181,localhost:2182/rootformysolr. In case the first part of the url path (='contextroot') is set to 'solr' (e.g. 'localhost:2181/solr' or 'localhost:2181/solr/..'), then that path is not considered as zookeeper chroot for backward compatibility reasons (this behaviour can be overridden via zkChroot parameter).

camel.sink.endpoint.allowCompression.name: camel.sink.endpoint.allowCompression
camel.sink.endpoint.allowCompression.description: Server side must support gzip or deflate for this to have any effect

camel.sink.endpoint.followRedirects.name: camel.sink.endpoint.followRedirects
camel.sink.endpoint.followRedirects.description: Indicates whether redirects are used to get to the Solr server

camel.sink.endpoint.password.name: camel.sink.endpoint.password
camel.sink.endpoint.password.description: Sets password for basic auth plugin enabled servers

camel.sink.endpoint.username.name: camel.sink.endpoint.username
camel.sink.endpoint.username.description: Sets username for basic auth plugin enabled servers

camel.component.solr.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.solr.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.solr.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.solr.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.solr.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.solr.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
